intro: Acosmium tenuifolium, commonly known as the slender-leaf acosmium, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
